references.paper_title: Why is misinformation a problem? Perspectives on Psychological Science
references.reason: This paper provides a broad overview of the problem of misinformation, setting the stage for the discussion of automated fact-checking.

references.paper_title: Factuality challenges in the era of large language models and opportunities for fact-checking
references.reason: This paper addresses the impact of large language models on the spread of misinformation and highlights the need for automated fact-checking.
This paper provides a comprehensive survey of existing work on automated fact-checking, giving valuable context to the research presented.

references.paper_title: Understanding the promise and limits of automated fact-checking
references.reason: This paper explores the challenges and limitations of automated fact-checking, providing insights into the gap between current capabilities and real-world needs.

references.paper_title: Human and Technological Infrastructures of Fact-checking
references.reason: This paper provides valuable insights into the human and organizational aspects of fact-checking, providing a practical foundation for building effective automated systems.
